bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Henry Rose Carter, Jr., February 20, 1948

div1.p: Hench is delighted to have the opportunity to look over Carter's papers. He promises to let Carter, Jr., know whatever he finds of historical value.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Henry Rose Carter, Jr., February 20, 1948
div1.opener:
February 20, 1948
Dr. Henry R. Carter, Jr.
Woodward Building
Birmingham 3, Alabama
My dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I appreciate greatly your letter of February 10,
and I am delighted that you approve the suggestion of
Mr. Redd that he lend me your father's letters.

Let me assure you again that I will take
extremely good care of them and summarize whatever
I find of historical value letting you know, of course,
what we have found.

I hope by now you have received the reprint.
If not, please let me know and I will send another.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
